channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: 无论是在停机坪上还是在会议室里，超级富豪们都对这些便鞋赞不绝口

item.title: 25 年前，《黑客帝国》想象了一个人类被科技割裂的未来。梅尔-索洛维奇克写道，它也提醒我们，反抗是可能的。
item.description:
Twenty-five years ago, "The Matrix" imagined a future where human beings are cut off from one another by technology. It also reminded us that resistance is possible, writes Meir Soloveichik. https://t.co/yXK2lTm5RC https://t.co/yXK2lTm5RC

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "私募股权》是一本关于在残酷、高风险的顶级对冲基金世界工作的回忆录。点击此处阅读节选。
item.description:
"Private Equity" is a memoir about working in the cutthroat, high-risk world of top hedge funds. Read an excerpt here. https://t.co/C3uLH0sNwm https://t.co/C3uLH0sNwm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/YzOV4FbDv9 https://t.co/YzOV4FbDv9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 为什么没有更多的东西像汽车一样需要召回？专栏作家乔-奎纳（Joe Queenan）提出了一些候选方案，比如外套上的故障拉链和上一部《夺宝奇兵》电影。
item.description:
Why aren’t more things subject to recalls like cars are? Columnist Joe Queenan suggests some candidates, like the faulty zipper on his jacket and that last Indiana Jones movie. https://t.co/idi4M4v0kp https://t.co/idi4M4v0kp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 超级名模吉赛尔-邦辰（Gisele Bündchen）几乎每天都坚持锻炼，并保持简单的饮食习惯。"她说："我的全部目标就是尽我所能活得最长，活得最好。
item.description:
Supermodel Gisele Bündchen exercises almost daily and keeps her diet simple. “My whole goal is to live the longest I can living the best life that I can,” she said. https://t.co/W2F7uKiWTK https://t.co/W2F7uKiWTK

item.title: 也许你很难相信，曾经的爱尔兰酒吧如今已奄奄一息。沿着爱尔兰令人惊叹的狂野大西洋路（Wild Atlantic Ways）的公路旅行，我们可以看到一些保留下来的酒吧。
item.description:
It may be hard to believe, but Irish pubs as they once were are a dying breed. This road trip along Ireland's stunning Wild Atlantic Ways offers a glimpse of some holdouts. https://t.co/9Fh4SANT0G https://t.co/9Fh4SANT0G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "整个后院都被毁了所有的景观都没了。"在经历了一天异常猛烈的风浪之后，佛罗里达州一对夫妇的房屋依然屹立不倒，这要归功于 30 根钢筋混凝土支柱。
item.description:
“The whole backyard is shot. All the landscaping is gone.” After a day of unusually heavy wind and waves, a Florida couple’s home is still standing, thanks to 30 concrete-and-steel pilings. https://t.co/J3uMcDl0aE https://t.co/J3uMcDl0aE

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 我们不再像过去那样关心工作。这在很大程度上要归咎于大流行病，它削弱了工作场所对人们心理的影响。
item.description:
We don’t care nearly as much about work as we used to. Blame it largely on the pandemic, which weakened the hold the workplace held on people’s psyches. https://t.co/sGF2Trcte5 https://t.co/sGF2Trcte5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 这道低热量、一碗一锅的胡萝卜蛋糕食谱既优雅又简单，在周末和节假日都非常适合。从现在起，它绝对会成为你的首选。

item.title: 它看起来就像一个标准的纽约市停车场。但自 2024 年初以来，这座位于曼哈顿西村的建筑已经签订了超过 1 亿美元的交易。

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：美国人明白，在威斯康星或阿拉斯加寒冷的冬天，没有一辆特斯拉能正常行驶；没有一辆福特 "闪电 "能胜任农场的工作。他们明白禁令意味着整个生活方式的终结，@KimStrassel 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Americans understand that no Tesla is going to function in the cold of a Wisconsin or Alaska winter; no Ford Lightning will manage the work of a farm. They understand a ban means the end of entire lifestyles, writes @KimStrassel. https://t.co/b3BEl1MUaA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 莫斯科郊外一个音乐厅发生袭击事件，造成至少 40 人死亡，100 多人受伤。美国官员认为 ISIS 与此次袭击有关。
item.description:
The U.S. warned Russia of a plot to target large crowds ahead of an attack that killed at least 40 people and injured over 100 at a concert hall outside of Moscow. U.S. officials believe ISIS was linked to the attack. https://t.co/Ftla81UbD4 https://t.co/Ftla81UbD4
